attributes.action: Move the General Election to after the CPS have decided whether to prosecute MPs
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the following news articles for further background on this issue: 

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/03/16/conservatives-fined-70000-mp-reported-police-following-investigation/

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/apr/10/tory-election-spending-johnny-mercer-mp-police-some-claims-were-wrong 

https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/3098923/police-considering-charging-as-many-as-20-tory-mps-over-dodgy-election-spending/
attributes.background: The CPS are currently decided whether or not to prosecute MPs for breaking spending restrictions under election laws. There are a reported 20 Conservative MPs who are under review. The British people should know the full details of the alleged electoral crimes before going to the polls this year.

rejection.details:
Her Majesty the Queen has made a proclamation setting Thursday 8 June as the date of the election. Once a proclamation like this has been made, the date of the election can’t be changed.

You can see the proclamation here:

https://privycouncil.independent.gov.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/List-of-Business-Privy-Council-25-04-17.pdf
